Which of the following statements is/are correct?
  1. Apparent Magnitude of a star refers to the brightness of a star as it appears.
  2. Absolute Magnitude of a star refers to the actual amount of light given off by a star at a standard distance.Â 
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Apparent magnitude of a star refers to how bright a star appears from Earth. It depends on brightness and the distance to a star. Absolute magnitude of a star refers to how bright a star would appear from a standard distance.
